2025-12-03:
Today was a horrible day
I overtraded and had terrible losses, 
I took TSLA with a full position as I thought the market was back on track, but that didn't happen, and the market is still choppy.
I am creating some rules to avoid days like these now-
When I have a loss 1st trade (big loss), I will take a 15-minute break (shut down the systems for 15 minutes)
I will restrict my total trades to just 2 more ( 3 in total) or stop trading
My Max loss will not exceed $100 now. Also, always take Trades near VWAP; if not, do a quick scalp! (Only VWAP and PML Breakouts)
No more 100% BP, 50% max
Psychology- Good, but once I got my 1st loss, I forgot all my rules and didn't see what was obvious

2025-12-10:
Today was the Day my account blew up
I lost my account on the market chop, and had bad day trading habits
I do not feel angry or sad as I grew up a lot from this challenge and found the core problems I had, for example, overtrading, taking B quality setups or trading the emotion (taking random trades and hoping)
Now I know what to do and have decided on how to move ahead with the challenge.
I am doing a 30 Day demo account now so that I can be back on track and basically skip this month, as I feel this entire month will be like this due to the lack of volume in this period.
After the 30-day period is done, we will come back and start another day trading challenge, where I will buy an account once again and see if it works for me.
Right now, I will settle for the rules I have made and honour them with discipline (check the rules page).
2025-12-11:
I feel I should take fewer trades and define my risk, as I realized that usually I am correct in predicting the movement of the stock, but keep a very tight stop loss or my entry is not good, which results in me getting stopped out a lot for small profits vs the big losses when it doesn't work.

If I start giving the trade enough room to breathe and only stick to my strategies, take A+ trades, and follow my plan, I can easily be profitable
